description:
Google accountants are a savvy bunch who handle the core accounting responsibilities at Google. As a member of this team, you know your accounting principles and the full accounting process end to end. You'll advise on financial reports required by governmental regulations, and you'll review, analyze, and interpret financial and budgetary reports -- and all this sounds like fun to you. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. A team player at heart, you collaborate with our global team, advocate best practices and roll up your sleeves to pitch in when it's all hands on deck. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.

The Cloud Business Finance team helps ensure contracting policies are executed accurately, keeps Finance leaders informed on market trends, and timely reports on growth and expenses. Within our team, the Operations Program Manager will focus on supporting business initiatives, including product launches, currency/FOP expansion, and acquisitions. You will work closely with the Cloud business to support and directly contribute to its growth, working collaborating with Product, Engineering, and other Finance teams to manage financial risk and develop and maintain scalable processes to support Cloud accounting and Sales compliance. In this role, you will work as port of a team and use excellent technical skills to deliver on deadlines and produce excellent work.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in public accounting and/or technology organizations.
  • Experience with revenue systems and models, project management, and product launches.

Preferred qualifications:

  • CPA, CA and/or knowledge of U.S. GAAP.
  • Experience with AR subledgers and other growth systems.
  • Experience empathizing with and influencing others without direct line authority, and resolving conflict diplomatically in tense high-pressure situations.
  • Experience working across different functional groups in a high growth company.
  • Excellent attention to detail and organization and program management skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Support Cloud product launches by providing finance and accounting requirements. Engage cross-functional departments including Product, Financial Planning and Analysis, Engineering, Treasury, Tax, and Financial Operations on new product and system initiatives.
  • Manage risks with an understanding of the business and end-to-end Finance processes.
  • Partner with Google Technical Support (GTS), Product Engineering, and Finance for new system launches and large product/legal entity changes.
  • Partner closely with the Controllership team to understand accounting requirements for new system solutions including multiple element arrangements, contract modifications, product upgrades, etc.
  • Develop an end-to-end understanding of the go-to-market processes to be able to identify dependencies between functions and systems and opportunities for improvement.
title: Operations Program Manager, Cloud Business Finance
